Evidence-Based Behaviour Support

Core Service Offerings

Delivering all services in alignment with the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission requirements.

üìä

Functional Behaviour Assessment (FBA)

A comprehensive assessment to understand the 'why' behind behaviours of concern. Includes data collection, stakeholder interviews, and direct observation.

  • Identification of triggers & functions
  • Baseline data establishment
  • Environmental analysis
üìù

Comprehensive PBS Plans

Development of tailored Behaviour Support Plans (BSP) that focus on proactive strategies, skill-building, and environmental changes.

  • Proactive & Reactive strategies
  • Skill development focus
  • Restrictive Practice reduction focus
ü§ù

Implementation & Training

Ensuring the plan works in real life. I provide hands-on training to families, carers, and support workers to ensure consistency.

  • Carer & Staff training
  • Plan reviews & monitoring
  • Collaboration with MDT teams

The Therapeutic Journey

My approach follows the gold standard Positive Behaviour Support framework, ensuring every participant receives data-driven, compassionate care.

01

Intake & Consent

Initial meeting to establish goals, explain rights, and ensure a good fit for the participant.

02

Data Collection (FBA)

Evidence-gathering through observation and interviews to find the function of the behaviour.

03

Plan Submission

Developing a robust PBS plan and lodging it with the NDIS Commission (where applicable).

04

Active Support

Ongoing implementation support, staff training, and regular progress reviews.

Provider FAQs

Commonly asked questions from Support Coordinators and Plan Managers.

What is your current waitlist?

I prioritize urgent referrals (e.g., risk of placement breakdown). General intake usually begins within 2‚Äì4 weeks of a signed service agreement.

Do you charge for travel?

Yes, travel is charged at the NDIS price guide rate (MM1). I strive to group sessions geographically to minimize travel costs for participants.

Can you manage Restrictive Practices?

Absolutely. I am experienced in identifying, lodging, and developing reduction strategies for regulated restrictive practices in compliance with NDIS Commission standards.

Do you work with MDT teams?

Yes. Collaborative care is essential. I frequently consult with OTs, Speech Pathologists, and Psychologists to ensure strategies are aligned.

Start the Intake Process

Download my service brochure or submit a referral to begin the collaboration.
